org.apache.mesos.offer.constrain

Class TaskTypeGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.offer.constrain.TaskTypeGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlacementRuleGenerator

    public class TaskTypeGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements PlacementRuleGenerator
    This rule ensures that the given Offer is colocated with (or never colocated with) the specified task 'type', whose retrieval from the TaskInfo is defined by the developer's implementation of a TaskTypeGenerator.TaskTypeConverter. For example, this can be used to colocate 'data' nodes with 'index' nodes, or to ensure that the two are never colocated.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  TaskTypeGenerator.TaskTypeConverter
      Given a TaskInfo, returns a type string for that task.
      static class  TaskTypeGenerator.TaskTypeLabelConverter
      Implementation of TaskTypeGenerator.TaskTypeConverter which expects a Label which provides the task type.

    • Method Detail

      • createAvoid

        public static PlacementRuleGenerator createAvoid(java.lang.String typeToAvoid,
                                                 TaskTypeGenerator.TaskTypeConverter typeConverter)
        Returns a PlacementRuleGenerator which enforces avoidance of tasks which have the provided type. For example, this could be used to ensure that 'data' nodes are never colocated with 'index' nodes, or that 'data' nodes are never colocated with other 'data' nodes (self-avoidance). Note that this rule is unidirectional; mutual avoidance requires creating separate colocate rules for each direction. Note that if the avoided task does not already exist in the cluster, this will just pick a random node, as there will be nothing to avoid.

      • createAvoid

        public static PlacementRuleGenerator createAvoid(java.lang.String typeToAvoid)
        Calls #createAvoid(String, TaskTypeConverter) with a {@link TaskTypeLabelConverter}.

      • createColocate

        public static PlacementRuleGenerator createColocate(java.lang.String typeToColocateWith,
                                                    TaskTypeGenerator.TaskTypeConverter typeConverter)
        Returns a PlacementRuleGenerator which enforces colocation with tasks which have the provided type. For example, this could be used to ensure that 'data' nodes are always colocated with 'index' nodes. Note that this rule is unidirectional; mutual colocation requires creating separate colocate rules for each direction. Note that if the colocated task does not already exist in the cluster, this will just pick a random node. This behavior is to support defining mutual colocation: A colocates with B, and B colocates with A. In this case one of the two directions won't see anything to colocate with.

      • createColocate

        public static PlacementRuleGenerator createColocate(java.lang.String typeToColocateWith)
        Calls #createColocate(String, TaskTypeConverter) with a {@link TaskTypeLabelConverter}.

      • generate

        public PlacementRule generate(java.util.Collection<TaskInfo> tasks)
        Description copied from interface: PlacementRuleGenerator
        Returns a new PlacementRule which defines where a task may be placed given the current deployed state of the system. The returned PlacementRule may then be tested against one or more Offers to find offered resources which match the constraints.
        Specified by:
        generate in interface PlacementRuleGenerator
        Parameters:
        tasks - all currently deployed tasks, against which the returned value is generated
